from or relating to Arabia, a large area of land in West Asia that includes Saudi Arabia, Yemen, Oman, Bahrain, Kuwait, Qatar, and the United Arab Emirates: The desert moon shone in a beautiful Arabian sky. The publisher specializes in Arabian history, travel, and literature. See also
Arabia
More examplesFewer examplesThe hotel was was like a fantasy of an Arabian village.They named her Alya, after an Arabian princess.This exhibition of South Arabian art, which is largely unknown in the West, offers many delightful surprises.

(also Arabian horse) a horse from a breed originally from Arabia, with a high tail and a particular shape of head: The famous warriors Alexander the Great, Napoleon, and Genghis Khan are all said to have ridden Arabians. She had in her stables some of the best Arabian horses. Synonym
Arab
old-fashioned a person from Arabia: Surviving inscriptions show that Roman soldiers posted to Hadrian's wall included Germans, Spaniards, Gauls, Africans, Syrians, and Arabians. His writing has dated badly, as he often portrayed Africans, Arabians, and Asians as evil or comic.
